newsitem.title: PANAMA: Panama free-trade zone Q1 exports rise 3.6 pct. [CORRECTED 10:10 GMT 21/6]
newsitem.headline: Panama free-trade zone Q1 exports rise 3.6 pct. [CORRECTED 10:10 GMT 21/6]

text.p: Exports from Panama's free-trade zone grew 3.6 percent to $1.363 billion during the first quarter of 1997 (corrects year from 1996), compared with $1.316 over the same period last year, the comptroller general's office said Friday.

"The favorable evolution of the free-trade zone in Colon is due to the better value and quantity of the goods re- exported from this zone," the comptroller general's office said in a notice published in local papers.

Exports from Panama's free-trade zone, which is the world's second largest after Hong-Kong, mainly consist of exports to and re-exports from the Colon free-trade zone, located 50 miles (80 km) from Panama City.
((-- Paul de Bendern, Panama City newsroom 507 223 7739))
